subject: Re: [junit] Junit test
msgSnippet: ... Put all the test data in an external file. I like XML for this because it gives me an easy grouping in the file. In the test s suite() method, read in the
messageBody:
On Thu, 2002-10-24 at 13:49, Sanjay Mantoor wrote:
> Please help me for the following issues.
> How data driven test cases can be done in JUnit without much change
> in test script?

Put all the test data in an external file. I like XML for this because
it gives me an easy grouping in the file.

In the test's suite() method, read in the file. For each grouping,
create a TestCase instance, add the data from the grouping to it, and
then stick it in the suite().

> What way Test results can be moved to log file.

Try the Jakarta Ant project (http://jakarta.apache.org/ant), and the
<junit> and <junitreport> tasks.

Robert.

--
"Software is too expensive to build cheaply"
